item.title: Bluesky issues its first transparency report, noting rise in user reports and legal demands
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Bluesky's first transparency reports tackle moderation, regulatory compliance, account takedowns, and more. The number of government legal requests went up fivefold.

item.title: Reid Hoffman urges Silicon Valley leaders to stop bending the knee to President Trump
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Some Valley CEOs have condemned recent border patrol events, but Hoffman urges them to wield their influence more powerfully.

item.title: Russian hackers breached Polish power grid thanks to bad security, report says
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The Polish government accused a Russian government hacking group of hacking into energy facilities taking advantage of default usernames and passwords.

item.title: Last 24 hours to grab your plus-one pass at 50% off to TechCrunch Disrupt 2026
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Today is the last day to lock in a plus-one pass at 50% off to TechCrunch Disrupt 2026, happening on October 13-15 in San Francisco.

item.title: How Sequoia-backed Ethos reached the public market while rivals fell short
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The profitable life-insurance platform was one of the first major tech companies to test the 2026 public markets.

item.title: The iPhone just had its best quarter ever
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: Growth in regions like China and India are credited with pushing Apple's phone sales higher than ever.

item.title: Guys, I don’t think Tim Cook knows how to monetize AI
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: One intrepid Morgan Stanley analyst dared to ask how Apple will make money on its AI investments. The answer will not shock you.

item.title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX, Tesla, and xAI in talks to merge, according to reports
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling, Kirsten Korosec
item.description: This merger would bring the Grok chatbot, Starlink satellites, and SpaceX rockets together under one corporation.

item.title: Amazon is reportedly in talks to invest $50B in OpenAI
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: If a deal materializes, it would mean Amazon is backing competing startups in the race for AI supremacy.

item.title: Medium employees given Friday off to participate in national strike protesting ICE
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Activists behind the general strike are calling for "no work, no school, and no shopping" amid a push to defund ICE, which has escalated raids in U.S. cities, killing several people, including two U.S. citizens earlier this month in Minneapolis.

item.title: Microsoft won’t stop buying AI chips from Nvidia, AMD, even after launching its own, Nadella says
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Microsoft says its own chip leapfrogs those made by other cloud providers like Amazon and Google. But it needs more.

item.title: Fintech firm Marquis blames hack at firewall provider SonicWall for its data breach
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The fintech giant said it plans to "seek recoupment of any expenses" from its firewall provider SonicWall after a 2025 data breach exposed customer firewall configurations.

item.title: Satya Nadella insists people are using Microsoft’s Copilot AI a lot
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: With Microsoft spending many billions on data centers, and rumors that no one is using its AI, CEO Satya Nadella shared some usage numbers.

item.title: Apple buys Israeli startup Q.ai as the AI race heats up
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Q.ai is an Israeli startup specializing in imaging and machine learning, particularly technologies that enable devices to interpret whispered speech and enhance audio in noisy environments.

item.title: Waymo robotaxis are now giving rides to and from San Francisco International Airport
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Waymo's SFO win comes as the company faces criticism and concerns about safety in some of the cities it operates.

item.title: I built marshmallow castles in Google’s new AI-world generator
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Starting Thursday, Google AI Ultra subscribers in the U.S. can play around with Project Genie, which is powered by a combination of Google’s latest world model Genie 3, its image generation model Nano Banana Pro, and Gemini.

item.title: OpenAI’s Sora app is struggling after its stellar launch
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: New data suggests the app is seeing declines in both app downloads and consumer spending, as the early hype about the AI video social network wears off.

item.title: Music publishers sue Anthropic for $3B over ‘flagrant piracy’ of 20,000 works
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Originally, these music publishers had filed a lawsuit against Anthropic over its use of about 500 copyrighted works.

item.title: India is teaching Google how AI in education can scale
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: With the highest global usage of Gemini for learning, India is emerging as a key market shaping Google's approach to AI in education.

item.title: Flapping Airplanes and the promise of research-driven AI
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: A new AI lab called Flapping Airplanes launched yesterday, and a Sequoia partner has an interesting take on why they stand out.
